meanings.definition: To act against or provide resistance to something.
meanings.sent1: I will oppose the new rule at the meeting.
meanings.sent2: She always opposes any changes to the schedule.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to oppose the bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The tree roots seemed to oppose the shovel's efforts to dig.
meanings.sent5: The hero stood firm, ready to oppose the villain's evil plans.

meanings.definition: To be in contrast or conflict with something.
meanings.sent1: His opinion will oppose hers in the debate.
meanings.sent2: The dark clouds seem to oppose the sunny sky.
meanings.sent3: The noisy party music seemed to oppose the quiet of the library.
meanings.sent4: The bright colors of the painting sharply oppose the dull background.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the medicine seemed to oppose the sweet candy.

meanings.definition: To compete against or be an adversary to someone.
meanings.sent1: The two teams will oppose each other in the final match.
meanings.sent2: She will oppose her friend in the chess tournament.
meanings.sent3: The siblings playfully oppose each other in every game.
meanings.sent4: The two companies constantly oppose each other in the market.
meanings.sent5: The rival candidates will oppose each other in the election.
